Dear Derrick McCree:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Samantha Way, at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Brittany Cowans, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Title Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention;
prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159
Section (2) The following restraints are strictly prohibited:
Description (e) Restraining youth in a prone position or any restraint that
restricts the youth's airway.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 completed an improper restraint with Youth A. Staff 1 put
their knee into Youth A's back.
Investigation Director was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS Worker
on 4/16/2025. Director stated Staff 1 is suspended pending the
completion of the investigation. He stated he is only aware of
Youth C’s continuance to sit in front of pod 4’s door all week and it
was irritating the other youth. On 4/10/2025, Youth C kept pushing
the call button for staff in the security room to open the door so
Youth C could leave the pod. Staff repeatedly asked Youth C to
remove himself from the front of the pod door and to stop pushing
the call button.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS Worker
on 4/17/2025. Youth A stated on 4/10/2025, Youth C would not
get away from the pod door and this upset him. He and Youth C
got into a physical altercation, and other youth were jumping in.
He stated the entire pod was fighting. He stated a staff member
opened the door, but he doesn’t recall who, and he ran into the
hallway. As Youth A ran into the hallway, he saw Staff 1 and
pushed him out of the way. He then ran back onto the pod and
into the showers so Staff 1 would not restrain him. He stated when
he ran back out, Staff 1 grabbed him from behind and carried him
to his room and was thrown onto his bed by Staff 1. Youth A’s feet
were to the floor, and he was lying on his side, and Staff 1’s arm
was around his head and his knee was on the left side of his face.
Youth A told Staff 1 that he was hurting him. Other staff members
came to assist, and it took Staff 4 and Staff 5 to get Staff 1 off
Youth A. Staff 5 also told Staff 1 to get off him, but he did not. He
kept telling Staff 1 that he could not breathe.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS Worker on
4/17/2025. Staff 1 reported he is up to date on training and the
facility utilizes the MANDT system for restraints. Staff 1 was not
2

initially on pod 4, but he heard a code yellow over the intercom,
and he began to walk towards pod 4. As he was entering the
hallway for pod 4, Youth A, another youth and another staff
member were standing near pod 4 door. He does not recall which
youth and staff members were there. He opened the pod 4 door
and Youth A tried to push past him. He stood in front of the door
and did not allow Youth A to push past him. He stated Youth A
tried to punch him a couple of times, but he was able to dodge his
hits. Youth A then ran onto the pod and began punching anyone
that was in his line of sight. Youth A then ran into the shower and
when he ran back out, Staff 1 put Youth A into a one-person side
body held. He stated that he approached Youth A from behind and
positioned himself form the side for his thigh to be up against
Youth’s A thigh. He wrapped his arms around Youth’s A waist and
Youth’s A left arms were inside of the wrap. Staff 1 then lifted
Youth A off the ground and carried him into his bedroom. Youth A
tried to physically assault him. Youth A began biting Staff 1 on his
arm and he used the MANDT technique to push the bottom of his
chin open and to release the bite. He stated he recalls Facility
Manager, Staff 4 and Staff 6 coming into the room to calm Youth
A down and then he left the room. Staff 1 denied using his knee to
push Youth’s A face into his bed and putting Youth’s A arm behind
his back.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS Worker
on 4/17/2025. Youth B stated Youth C was mad that he could not
go anywhere, and he was sitting in front of the pod door. Youth A
was standing near the door and Youth C began pinching and
punching Youth A. Youth A and Youth C began to fight, and staff
intervened and broke them up. He stated he has an “alright”
relationship with Staff 1. He does not like the way Staff 1 restrains
him as Staff 1 has grabbed him and other youth, and this upsets
everyone, Youth B did not provide additional details. He does not
know the type of restraints staff are supposed to use with the
youth. He did see Youth A and Staff 1 inside of Youth’s A
bedroom. He saw Staff 1’s hand on Youth A’s neck and his face
was pushing into his bed mat. He heard Youth A say to Staff 1,
“get off me” but he did not hear Staff 1 say anything. He does not
know how it ended because he was taken off the pod and went to
the library. Youth B was asked about Youth B restraining Youth F,
as seen in the video. Youth B stated he does not recall restraining
Youth F.
Youth C was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS Worker
on 4/17/2025.Youth C stated on 4/10/2025, he was sitting in front
of the pod door because he was mad about being on the pod. He
3

did not remember where he wanted to go. He stated Staff 4 and
Staff 5 were telling him to move, and also Youth A. He stated
Youth A began hitting him and staff were able to break up the
fight. The unit had to go on lockdown due to several fights
occurring on the pod. He was taken off the pod and to the dining
hall, and he does not know what else happened on the pod. Youth
C denied seeing any restraints or physical contact by Staff 1 with
other youth.
Youth D was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS Worker
on 4/17/2025. Youth D stated Youth C was upsetting everyone on
4/10/2025 and it caused many fights on the pod. He stated he saw
Staff 1 restrain Youth A and Youth A fell to the ground. He does
not know what occurred afterwards, as he was not present.
Youth E was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS Worker
on 4/17/2025. Youth E stated the initial altercation on 4/10/2025
started because Youth C was sitting in front of the pod door and
would not move. He is not familiar with Staff 1 and did not see
Staff 1 restrain Youth A. Youth E stated he did witness Youth A
bent over his bed with his feet to the floor and Staff 1 standing
behind Youth A, bent over on top of Youth A. He did hear Youth A
say that he couldn’t’ breathe.
Youth F was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS Worker
on 4/17/2025. Youth F stated he saw Staff 1 fighting with Youth A
on 4/10/2025. He saw Staff 1 push Youth A down to the ground.
Youth F grabbed Staff 1 and told Staff 1 to get off Youth A. Youth
F was then restrained by Youth B but no one told Youth B to
restrain him. He stated he saw Staff 1 put his knee into Youth’s A
head and Youth A kept saying, “get off”. He does not recall what
happened after as the youth were instructed to go into their
rooms.
Facility Manager was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS
worker on 4/17/2025. Staff 2 stated on 4/10/2205, he heard a
code yellow over the intercom, and as he was in the hallway of
Pod 4, he saw Youth A punch Staff 1 as Staff 1 was going through
the door to enter Pod 4. He stated he tried to deescalate the
situation by talking to Youth A. He did witness Staff 1 restrain
Youth A in a side body hold, and put him in his room. He also
witnessed Staff 4 trying to separate Youth A and Staff 1, as Youth
A kept trying to hit Staff 1. He was asked to leave the pod, so he
did not witness anything else. He reported the restraint was
proper.
4

Staff 3 was interviewed over the phone with MDHHS worker
on 5/6/2025. Staff 3 reported all the youth were fighting on
4/10/2025 on Pod 4. Staff 4 reported near the end of staff and
youth calming down, she saw Staff 1 grab Youth a from behind
and carry Youth A to his bedroom. Youth A was kicking and trying
to get out of the hold. She reported she saw Staff 1 pushing Youth
A onto his bed. Youth A had Staff 1’s hood, and Staff 1 grabbed
Youth’s A arm and put it behind Youth’s A back and Youth A was
screaming for Staff 1 to stop. She Staff 4, and Staff 6 all told Staff
1 to stop. Staff 1 did not stop, and Staff 4 entered into the
bedroom, and he put his body between Staff 1 and Youth A. She
stated that Staff 1 kept saying, “he swung on me, he swung on
me”. Staff 1 was referring to Youth A. She stated this was an
improper restraint as Staff 1 had Youth A’s neck and face pushed
down into the bed. She stated the proper restraint would have
been a 2-man escort or blind side scope. Staff 3 stated Youth B
always tries to deescalate situations; however, no one told him to
restrain Youth F. Staff have repeatedly told Youth B to not touch
another youth.
Staff 4 was interviewed over the phone with MDHHS worker
on 5/6/2025. Staff 4 recalled a lot of altercations with the youth on
Pod 4 on 4/10/2025. Staff 4 reported he was standing outside of
Youth’s A bedroom door when he saw Staff 1 had Youth’s A arm
behind his back and Staff 1’s other hand was on Youth’s A neck.
Staff 1 was pushing Youth A’s face into the bed mat. He heard
Youth A say, “You’re grabbing my neck, you’re hurting me.” Staff 6
went into the room and told Staff 1 to stop and let Youth A go.
Staff 1 did not let Youth A go and that is when Staff 4 walked into
the bedroom, stood on Youth’s A bed and had to pry Staff 1’s
hands off of Youth A. He stated Staff 1 said, “he got me, he got
me”. Staff 1 was referring to Youth A holding him. He stated that
he grabbed Staff 1’s arms and had to get in between the staff and
youth to separate them. 1 would not leave Youth A’s room. He
was not sure how long Staff 1 was in Youth A’s room.
Staff 5 was interviewed over the phone on 6/4/2025. Staff 5
stated she was on another pod when she heard a “code red”
called. She initially saw Youth A and Staff 1 in the hallway outside
of the pod arguing. She was able to get Staff 1 and Youth A back
onto the pod. She doesn’t recall seeing the initial restraint
between Staff 1 and Youth A, as there was a lot of commotion
once she entered the pod. Staff 5 reported when she was
standing outside of Youth’s A bedroom door, she witnessed Youth
A pulling on Staff’s 1 hoodie inside his bedroom. Staff 1 snatched
it from him and Youth A tried to hit Staff 1 but missed. Staff 1
5

pushed Youth’s A face into his bed with his hand. Staff 5 stated
Staff 1 was holding one arm of Youth A behind Youth A’s back
and Staff 1 had his other hand around Youth’s A neck. Staff 5
further described this as Youth A’s feet were to the floor and belly
to the bed (in a bent over position) while Staff 1 stood behind him
with his feet on the floor and one hand around Youth A's neck
pushing his face into the mattress and Staff 1’s other hand pulling
one of Youth A’s arms behind his back, restricting his movement.
She reported Staff 1 did not complete a proper restraint. She did
not see Staff 1 scratch Youth A and she doesn’t know if Youth A
had the scratches on his face and neck prior to entering his
bedroom. She stated once Staff 6 walked into the bedroom Staff 1
calmed, Staff 5 walked away and did not witness anything further.
Staff 6 was interviewed over the phone on 6/5/2025. Staff 6
stated she was standing outside of Youth’s A bedroom door when
she witnessed Staff 1 holding Youth A down into his concrete bed
by placing his hand on the side of his neck and face. Staff 6
described this as Youth A was bent over his bed, with his feet to
the floor, belly to the bed and Staff 1 standing behind him with one
arm to his beck, pushing Youth A’s face in the mattress and Staff
1’s other hand pulling one of Youth A’s hand behind his back. She
repeatedly told Staff 1 to stop and Staff 4 had to go into the room
and used his body to be in-between Youth A and Staff 1. This is
when Staff 1 stopped holding onto Youth A and walked out of the
room. She stated Staff 1’s restraint of Youth A was not in
compliance with the MANDT training. She does not recall Youth A
having injuries prior to entering the room but she cannot say for
sure if Youth’s A scratches were caused by Staff 1.
Video Review:
In the beginning of the video, Staff 3 and Staff 6 are at Pod 4’s
entrance with Youth A, Youth B, and Youth E. Youth C was sitting
on the floor blocking the door, holding up Pod 4's activity time. At
the 5:33 pm mark of the video, Staff 4 is sitting at a table, stands
up and approaches the group at the door. Staff 4 and Staff 5, are
at the door attempting to get Youth C to get up and stop blocking
the door. Youth A is at the door telling Youth C to get up and
move away from the door. Youth C ignores Youth A, Youth B and
Youth E, and Youth A kicks Youth C while he is on the ground
sitting in front of the door. Staff 3 and Staff 6 attempt to shield
Youth C, and then Youth A grabs Youth C and drags him away
from the door. Staff 3, Staff 4 and Staff 6 move themselves in front
of Youth C. Youth A starts to kick Youth C again. Youth E starts to
grab Youth C by his neck and puts him in a head lock. Staff 3,
Staff 4 and Staff 6 attempt to separate all the youth. Youth C is
6

still on the floor attempting to block the door and Youth A grabbed
Youth C and attempted to drag him across the floor. Youth A lets
go and Youth C gets up while Staff 3, Staff 4 and Staff 6 attempt
to shield Youth A and Youth C from each other. Staff 3 separated
both youths. Youth C then swings backwards and hits Staff 3.
Youth A gets upset and started taking off his pants to fight Youth
C. Youth A gets up and starts punching Youth C and punches
Staff 3 while she is trying to separate them. Staff 3 grabs Youth A
by the shoulders and attempts to remove him from the situation.
Youth E starts to punch Youth C in the face as Staff 6 attempts to
separate the two of them.
Youth A reenters the common area, and he is attempting to get
away from Staff 3 as the other youths are in the common area
fighting. Youth A breaks loose from Staff 3 and punches Youth C
in the face knocking him to the ground and continuously punches
Youth C as Staff 3 attempts to pull him off Youth C. Staff 4
reenters the POD and removes Youth A from the unit. At the 5:41
mark in the video Facility Manager, Staff 1, Staff 4 and Staff 5
enter the Pod and Youth A runs from behind them forcing his way
back on the Pod and attempts to start punching Youth A. Youth D
grabbed Youth C in a head lock and Facility Manger attempted to
separate the two youth. Youth A started to swing at Staff 1 and
when Staff 1 attempted to stop him, Youth A fell to the floor and
Staff 1 disengaged. Youth F attempted to run towards Staff 1 and
assault him while Staff 1 was attempting to deescalate the
situation. Youth B grabbed Youth F, holding him and talking to
him.
Youth C was removed from the Pod and all the youth attempted to
calm down. All youth were redirected to their rooms when Youth E
walked up and attempted to hand Youth A an unidentified object.
Youth D became upset and started arguing and pushing Youth B.
Staff 1, Staff 3 and Staff 6 separated the two youth. Youth D
became upset and spit on Facility Manager. Staff 1 blocked Youth
A from running towards and attacking Youth D. Youth A was
running around attempting to assault Youth A, Staff 1 attempted to
stop him, and Youth A swung at Staff 1 and Staff 1 grabbed him
and let Youth A go, and he fell to the ground. Staff attempted to
place youth in their rooms. Youth A attempted to go into another
youth's room and Staff 1 approached Youth A from behind and
positioned himself form the side for his thigh to be up against
Youth A’s thigh. He wrapped his arms around Youth A’s waist and
Youth A’s left arms was inside of the wrap. Staff 1 then lift Youth A
off the ground and carried him into his bedroom while Youth A
7

continuously punched him in his head. At 5:46 pm mark, Youth A
was placed in his room with Facility Manager and Staff 1. There is
no video available of what occurs inside the room. Staff 1 and
Staff 3 exited the room at 5:48 pm and Staff 1 exited the Pod at
5:49pm. After this, Facility Manager attempts to verbally
deescalate Youth A who could be heard screaming and yelling
and hitting the wall in his room. Youth A forced his way out of his
room and ran around the unit. Facility Manager talked with Youth
A, and Youth A entered his room at the 5:52 mark and everyone
was off the floor.
Documentation Reviewed:
• Medical Assessment progress note dated 4/11/2025;
Scratches observed to left face and neck. Youth stated this
is due to the restraint. Staff 1 threw him on his bed with his
arm behind his back and knee in his neck. Superficial
injuries to left side of neck and face.
• Two pictures of Youth A; red marks and scratches to
Youth’s A face and neck.
• Unusual Incident Report Summary dated 4/11/2025 by
Facility Manager: While on Pod 4 as Staff 6 was entering
the Pod, Youth C was sitting at the pod door. Youth A,
Youth B and Youth E all walked to the door in an attempt to
get Youth C away from the door with Staff 4 assisted with
the verbal de-escalation by counseling. Staff 6 was able to
enter pod; Staff 6 and Staff 3 were attempting to de-
escalate the youth as they were becoming escalated,
unsuccessful. Youth A and Youth E assaulted Youth C by
grabbing and pulling at them. Staff 6 and Staff 3 stepped in-
between the youth to keep them separated. Staff 3 placed
Youth C in a two-arm hold at 5:38pm for 41 seconds and
then released him. Youth E then charged at Youth C; both
exchanged punches. Staff 6 stepped in-between to keep
them separated. Staff 5, Staff 1 and this writer (Facility
Manager) arrived on the Pod. Upon entering, Youth D was
being verbally aggressive toward Staff 6 as they were
attempting to get a chair from them as they were attempting
to join the fight. Youth B attempted to help Staff 6 get the
chair; Youth D then became more upset and assaulted
Youth B by punching him in the facial area. Staff 4 stepped
in-between both Residents to keep them apart. Youth A
and Youth F charged up with Youth B and began punching
Youth D. This writer stepped in-between the Residents to
block Youth D from being further assaulted. Youth D then
spit and punch this writer who then placed him in a two-arm
hold at 5:43pm and escorted him to his room placing him
8

on seclusion at 5:45pm for 35 minutes (6:20pm) until he
had regained self-control. Youth F was placed on Seclusion
at 5:45pm and was taken off at 6:20pm. Youth A began
running towards the Shower area, Staff 1 Youth A in a two-
arm hold at 5:45pm and escorted to his room for a time-out
with the door ajar. All Residents are scheduled to be
examined by the Facility Nurse.
• Staff 1 training log: MANDT Verbal De-Escalation
Techniques – completed on 2/28/2025 and MANDT
Physical Skills completed on 3/27/2025.
• Youth Complaint/Grievance Form dated 4/10/2025 by
Youth A; Stated he was restrained in the wrong way by
Staff 1. He was thrown into his room and Staff 1 was on top
of him. Staff 1’s hands were around his neck and his knee
was on his face. He was almost choking, and he could
barely breathe. It took two staff to come get Staff 1 off him.
• Staff 1 Suspension Pending Investigation dated 4/11/2025
by Director; Issue Under Investigation: MANDT.
• Youth Discipline and Behavior Modification Policy;
Spectrum Juvenile Justice Services prohibits cruel and
unusual punishment including all of the following: Any type
of physical discipline; The use of excessive Chemical,
Mechanical, or Physical Restraint; Hitting or striking,
throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a youth on any part of
their body.
• MANDT Model: One-Person Side Body Hold
o Staff approached from the side and slightly behind
the person.
o Both hands contact the person’s upper am.
o Staff simultaneously move their front foot across the
front of the person’s body and front hand to the
person’s opposite hip.
o The staff member placed their thigh again in the
person’s thigh, their belt buckle up against the
person’s hip, and the person’s arm will be tucked
into the staff member’s armpit
o Staff reaches behind the person with their hand to
the person’s opposite hip
o Staff tucks their head behind the person’s shoulder
blade and relaxes.
• MANDT Model: Two-Person Escort
o Staff must communicate with the person and with
each other.
o Each staff member stands behind and slightly to one
side.
9

o Each staff member places one hand just above the
elbow, with the thumb on the inside and fingers on
the outside of the arm.
o Each staff member simultaneously places their other
hand on the person’s opposite hip. Their arms will
cross in the back.
o Both staff members can then escort the individual to
a safe destination.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as during staff interviews,
youth interviews, and video reviewed, Staff 1 put Youth A in a
prone restraint position with Youth A’s belly to the bed and had
restricted Youth A’s airway when Youth A’s face was pushed into
his mattress. Youth A told Staff 1 he could not breathe.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Title Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing
a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A has scratches on the left side of his neck. It is unknown if
this occurred during the improper restraint by Staff 1 or the fight.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS Worker
on 4/17/2025. He stated when he ran out from the showers of the
pod, Staff 1 grabbed him from behind and carried him to his room
and then threw him onto his bed by Staff 1. Youth A was lying on
his side, and Staff 1’s arm was around his neck and his knee was
on the left side of his face. Youth A told Staff 1 that he was hurting
him. Other staff members came to assist, and it took Staff 4 and
Staff 5 to get Staff 1 off Youth A. Staff 5 also told Staff 1 to get off
him, but he did not. Youth A stated that he suffered injuries to his
face and neck from Staff 1 pushing his face into his bed mat with
his hand around his neck being chocked. He kept telling Staff 1
that he could not breathe.
10

Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS worker on
4/17/2025. Staff 1 reported he did not physically assault, scratch
or swing on Youth A during the restraint. Staff 1 denied pushing
Youth A into his bed. He stated when he carried Youth A into his
room, Youth A began to bite him, therefore he used the MANDT
technique to push the bottom of his chin open and to release the
bite. Then Facility Manager, Staff 4 and Staff 6 came into the
room to calm Youth A down, and he left the room.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS worker on
4/17/2025. Youth B reported Youth A and Youth C were fighting
on the pod prior to Staff 1 restraining Youth A. Youth B stated
when Youth A and Youth C were fighting, Youth A did not have
any scratches on his neck. He believes Youth A received his
scratches when Staff 1 was restraining him, and Staff 1’s hand
was around Youth A’s neck. He stated he witnessed Youth A in
his bedroom and Staff 1 had his hand on Youth’s A neck. He
heard Youth A tell Staff 1 to get off him and Staff 1 did not say
anything. He did not witness any further physical contact between
Youth A and Staff 1.
Youth C was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS Worker
on 4/17/2025. He stated Youth A told him Staff 1 scratched him.
Youth C believes that to be untrue because he saw blood under
Youth’s A fingernails. Youth C did not see any physical
encounters between Youth A and Staff 1.
Youth D was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS Worker
on 4/17/2025. He stated he saw Staff 1 restrain Youth A and
Youth A fell to the ground. He does not know what occurred
afterwards, as he was not present. Youth D stated Staff 1 has
many incidents of pushing people down. He does not like Staff 1
because of how Staff 1 restrains him and the other youth by
pushing youth. No further details were provided.
Youth E was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS Worker
on 4/17/2025. Youth E stated he witnessed Youth A bent over his
bed with his feet to the floor and Staff 1 standing behind Youth A,
bent over on top of Youth A in Youth’s A bedroom. He did not
witness any further physical contact between Youth A and Staff 1.
Youth F was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS Worker
on 4/17/2025. Youth F stated he saw Staff 1 fighting with Youth A
on 4/10/2025. He saw Staff 1 push Youth A down to the ground.
Youth F stated he witnessed Staff 1 putting his knee on Youth A’s
head while they were in Youth’s A room. He overheard Youth A
11

yell, “get off”. He does not recall what happened after. He did not
witness any further physical contact between Youth A and Staff 1.
Staff 3 was interviewed over the phone with MDHHS worker
on 5/6/2025. Staff 3 reported that Youth A did not have scratches
on his neck prior to Staff 1 being in Youth A’s room while
restraining him. She did observe Staff 1 pushing Youth A’s neck
and face down into the bed with both of his hands.
Staff 4 was interviewed over the phone on with MDHHS
worker on 5/6/2025. Staff 4 reported Youth A did not have
scratches on his neck prior to Staff 1 restraining him, however, he
did not observe Staff 1 physically scratch Youth A on his neck and
face. Staff 4 stated she saw Staff 1 grab Youth A from behind and
carry Youth A to his bedroom. Youth A was kicking and trying to
get out of the hold. He reported she saw Staff 1 pushing Youth A
onto his bed and Staff 1 put Youth A’s arm behind his back, and
Staff’s 1 other hand was on Youth’s A neck. He observed Staff 1
push Youth’s A face into the mattress.
Nurse was interviewed over the phone on with MDHHS
worker on 5/6/2025. Nurse reported she saw Youth A for his
injuries on 4/11/2025. She noted she saw a few abrasions on the
left side of Youth’s A neck and the side of his face. Youth A’s
injuries were superficial, and he was able to move his neck. Nurse
stated that it is possible Youth’s A injuries were sustained from
staff restraining or when Youth A was involved in the several
altercations with other youth on the pod on 4/10/2025. Youth A
told her that Staff 1 threw him on his bed, lying sideways, and was
restrained on his bed with his arm behind his neck and Staff 1’s
knee was in the side of Youth A’s face.
Staff 5 was interviewed over the phone on 6/4/2025. Staff 5
reported she was standing outside of Youth’s A bedroom door and
she witnessed Youth A pulling on Staff’s 1 hoodie inside his

Safe Physical Intervention Techniques (Youth Restraint)
1. In situations in which verbal and non-physical forms of

length of time necessary to secure and restore safety to the
youth and others; 3. Only the approved SJJS safe physical
management techniques may be used; 4. Only staff trained
in the SJJS approved safe non-violent physical intervention
techniques shall use a physical intervention; 5. Physical
Intervention (Restraint) may only be used when a youth is
in the act of (1) harming self, (2) assaulting other persons,
(3) committing a serious act of destruction of property that
places the youth or others at a serious risk of injury, (4)
jeopardizing the safety of others or (5) jeopardizing the

intervention must be reported to the immediate supervisor
and documented on an Unusual Incident Report summary
and the appropriate restraint, seclusion, aggregate
seclusion forms and logs; 7. The supervisor shall report all
instances of the use of a physical intervention in
